website_summaries.verdict: Light and agile. Ideal for many urban gardens.
pros: Effective at cutting both backward and forward
We love the grass-catching bag that minimizes mess
Customers report they adapt easily to the cutting cadences of this model
cons: A few owners had problems with the mower tripping breakers when starting

customer_reviews.title: Great mower, until it dies
customer_reviews.text: I had this mower for just over 8 months before it died, and just trips my breaker now. I should've listened to other reviewers here warning of this. Currently waiting to hear back from the manufacturer, but I'm not getting my hopes up since they're a marketing company and not really a product company.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Selby

customer_reviews.title: Easy to push, no assembly, works great!
customer_reviews.text: This mower is better than I expected! There is literally no assembly needed- the handle double folds down and you just open it up and lift the handle and tighten. It mows great- my grass was long and it had no trouble at all. One nice feature is that the flap to take the grass catcher off has a top flap so it’s easy to flip it up and see how full it is as opposed to having to open it and pull the catcher out. This little guy is easy to push, easy to use and is better than my old Black and Decker electric mower.
customer_reviews.author: Lightning Le Bran

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed- Cant Mow Lawn - Trips every time
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box this lawn mower immediately tripped the gfci breaker. Used the required awg power cable per the manual. Called support and they told me,to try a different cable which I did increasing the awg to 12 awg and still tripped my gfci. Frustrated because return policy is only 30 days which if you take time between mows is used up fast. Really disappointed and regret this,purchase. Looking to get full refund with mtg mfg or Amazon...
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Muckley

customer_reviews.title: Worst Company Ever with Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: Had to give 1 star or would get a zero. Ordered the corded model plugged in cut lawn once and then when I went to use it the following week it wouldn’t start. Returned that got a new one since I actually did like the results of the one time it did cut. Well put it together today and would not start. This company does not quality check anything before it goes out so stay far away. It’s a shame companies think this is acceptable business practices.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a year
customer_reviews.text: I have a fairly small lot so I didn't need a huge mower. It worked great for the first few months (purchased in 7/19). It's very lightweight and didn't require much assembly time. The cut was even and it's great to be able to easily adjust the cutting height. Fast forward 8 months. It was stored in my garage when not in use, went to start it up this year and nothing. Tried different cords, outlets and still it wouldn't start. I like that there is a 4 year warranty, but I am yet to see what the experience is in getting a replacement or a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Alaina

customer_reviews.title: Used
customer_reviews.text: It looks like I ordered a used mower. I’m not happy. The photos were taken immediately after delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Christy Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Horrible!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working the second time I used it. Fixed it due to common failure. used 2 more times, now nothing!!!! Will never buy their product again.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Shine

customer_reviews.title: My husband enjoyed the efficiency!!!
customer_reviews.text: We received the electric mower much quicker than expected. My husband assembled it quickly and within 10 minutes (connecting extension cords) was mowing the lawn like he was using a vacuum on carpet! The mower was so efficient that he finished the lawn quickly. What normally took an hour, literally took like 25 minutes. So he brought it to the backyard to test it there... where we had tall grass and weeds growing. The mower did a fantastic job!!! The best part was seeing my husband enjoy the quick results for less effort than pushing a gas powered mower. Love this mower and would highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Just set it and forget it
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this mower. Its lightweight that even my Mom can use it, it has enough power to get the job done, and its also a lot less noisier then a gas powered mower. Its pretty convenient you can adjust the ride height of all four corners at the same time with one handle. The only assembly needed was tightening the handle bar in place since its folded when shipped (No tools needed). The grass bag/catcher has more then enough capacity. I had to empty it out three times for my yard size. Paired with:
customer_reviews.author: Richard Landaverde

customer_reviews.title: Great product, works well. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Owned this mower for 2 weeks now, been working well so far. Very easy to assemble (took me like 5 minutes), really like the easy start button, very light weight and easy to maneuver, cuts the grass just fine. My yard is fairly small so this was a good solution for me. I keep it outside covered in a water proof cover. I use the recommended power cord (14 gauge for 50ft extension cord) and plug into a surge protector rated for 20amps which also comes with a 40ft retractable extension cord. I personally recommend this for people with small yards since it’s corded. Great mower and overall value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Javier

customer_reviews.title: Broken Cam Locks
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to try this machine out, but was frustrated when it came with a broken cam lock at the bottom. This made it impossible to secure the handle. The camlock was situated improperly by 90 degrees, making it impossible to latch. I figured I just received a bad item and support was great in ordering a free pickup and delivering a new machine. The second machine had the EXACT same issue, which was extremely frustrating. I got a refund but will be looking for a different lawn mower..
customer_reviews.author: Alissa Le

customer_reviews.title: Nice - great value
customer_reviews.text: Review after one use: Very light weight, easy to maneuver (no need at all for self propeller). Just wide enough. Plenty of power (lawn was about 8 inches high, but only had to go over a couple of spots). As someone else said, I did need to change mowing pattern/ figure out easiest pattern to accommodate the cord. Cord does not fall out, mower has widgets to hold it firmly in place. Works great with 50ft 14G cord. No complaints, esp for $130! Will update if problems develop after a few uses.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strong cut higher wetter grass and folds handle fits small soace.
customer_reviews.text: Cuts good including thicker higher rye that was moist and scalps well too. Safety 2 things must do in order to start it so no issues when empty or have turn over and clean deck. Collects in bag well. Lighter than old electric with metal deck. Handle folds just flip of clip and fits in small shed. Would recommend. The cutting doesnt extend so far to edge of mover though.
customer_reviews.author: Norma Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great for small, light duty spaces.
customer_reviews.text: We live in condominiums and have a postage stamp of a back lawn that isn't maintained by the HOA. We're responsible for it. Our son has been using a manual mower for years because a regular mower is just to big and bulky for the space. But my husband finally broke down and bought this little number this past summer. Now he can mow the lawn himself and my son doesn't have to do it. Yay.
customer_reviews.author: Never At A Loss For Words

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would have opened it when we first got it in November. Used it for the first time this year. One the second time out the screws popped off of the handled and now we're using zip ties to hold it together. Can't adjust the handle and stopping to put more ties on throughout the use. Too late to return. No more buying major purchases online. Spent too much money for this to be falling apart after a couple of uses. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: R. Russell

customer_reviews.title: Good little mower.
customer_reviews.text: We have a smallish yard and have had this corded lawnmower for nearly 3 years. It's been doing great - no maintenance. This spring it wouldn't start but my husband was able to get it going again, by bypassing the start button. You just hold the handle now and it starts right up. The teenager ran over the cord once, with no ill effects (well, the cord was toast, but other than that everything else was fine). It's a good little mower and suits us just fine.
customer_reviews.author: GretchenNC

customer_reviews.title: First impressions, works great!
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to assemble, and worked as soon as I plugged in the extension cord. It was light enough to maneuver around the yard, and cut the slightly longer grass no problem on height setting 3. The bag collected grass just fine. Will update if I run into any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: HAPPY SO FAR
customer_reviews.text: Bought it too suck up pine needles & leaves between 3 big pine trees..have a 48 inch zero turn but only mulch with it...this little mower work very well sucking up needles..alot easier than raking up piles..had too put it on 2 & did very well cutting through thick grass..very economical...battery operated would b my first choice but twice the money.. Cord is a pain in the butt but very good power..it folded up very nicely & takes up very little room..very satisfied for first time using this mower..
customer_reviews.author: Mark E Burris

customer_reviews.title: MowingBEAST!!
customer_reviews.text: My mower is awesome SAUCE!! Its not as quiet as I'd thought it would be, but it's no louder than a gas operated mower....its easy to use and store and very light weight...I do recommend also purchasing this extension cord:  - US Wire 65100 12/3 100-Foot SJTW Orange Heavy Duty Extension Cord - It was recommended by another purchaser. I was concerned with the reviews stating that their mower burned out...purchasing the proper gauge heavy duty cord for this mower is critical. Especially when I measured it against heavy extension cords that I already have....THIS cord is a beast...it also weighed a lot more...so I am glad I follow the recommendation...
customer_reviews.author: Stacey106

customer_reviews.title: Best solution for long term SMALL yard.
customer_reviews.text: IF you have a SMALL yard, this is a much, much better solution than a battery powered mower. I have a 8 yr old battery mower, batteries die over time and need replacing. Replacement batteries are expensive, I did it once, when replacement died I looked at corded. Yes, you have to move a cord around and be careful not to mow over it. But I will no longer have to wait to charge my battery, or find out that it won't take a charge. And this is less than half the price of battery mower and about the same as a replacement battery. So winner, winner.
customer_reviews.author: Denny Da K

customer_reviews.title: Even though it is a compact mower, it does a great job, especially the mulching feature.
customer_reviews.text: I live in a community where the landscaping is taken care of, but because the grass is bermuda, it grows very quickly as the weather gets hotter, I wanted to have a small mower for in-between mowing.I also do not have that much room in my garage. This lawnmower is light, maneuverable,and , surprisingly powerful, despite being only 10 amps. I am used to self-propelled gas mowers, but this little guy really does the job! I highly recommended it.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Dicker

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for small yards.
customer_reviews.text: We recently moved from an apartment to a house so I didn't know too much about mowers. As I didn't want to mess with gasoline and all that I bought this electric corded machine. My yard is about 1500 - 2000 sq F and I do the work in about 40 minutes, I 've used it a couple of times so far and does a very good job. My yard was not in the best shape but this mower cuts grass and thicker weed easily. The only thing that could improve is the size of the bag. I need to empty it out about 4-5 times
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best electric mower I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I have a small, sloping lawn. Because the power cord length is manageable for small lawns, this mower allows me to avoid the stink and fuel inefficiency of a gas mower and to avoid the weight of a battery operated electric mower. It certainly does the job. It is thoughtfully engineered to easily change cutting heights and the handle folds and unfolds and locks easily. The bag is easy to install. There is an easily installed "plug " for using it bagless in the mulching mode. I suggest that you use a dry lubricant spray on the underside to prevent cut grass from sticking.
customer_reviews.author: niceold guy

customer_reviews.title: Didnt think a electric mower was going to be Any good
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to cut my lawn that I just let go. After a few months of owning the home I decided to look into buying a mower because I hate having the ugliest lawn. After looking into I didnt even know they made electric mowers and was highly skeptical to the idea but after some debate with my wife what could we lose I was paying a kid to cut my grass while I can buy this for one price and cut mine anytime I see the grass get to long. This lawnmower made me a believer that corded electric mowers are up there with the best.
customer_reviews.author: Ish

customer_reviews.title: I'm an elderly woman, not Hercules.
customer_reviews.text: You know only old women are going to buy a mower like this, not young men or any men for that matter. Your instruction say "just" snap the levers in place ( which pretty much keeps the handle on ) like it's as easy as pie to do. Not every old woman out there has a husband, son or brother around to snap these things in place. Bottom line, I have a brand new mower which I really need and I can never use it because you made your "snaps" impossible to budge. Thanks a lot for nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Deckman

customer_reviews.title: Great for mulching leaves
customer_reviews.text: We have a backyard with a lot of trees in back of us that belong to someone else. Even though there is lawn maintenance through the HOA, they don't come often enough or do a good job of getting rid of all the leaves. My husband loves this mower because it is lightweight, was easy to assemble, doesn't take up much space to store and most important, does a great job of mulching the leaves. The price was also great $109.00. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: avid mystery reader

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Camper Mower
customer_reviews.text: I have a small lot where my Camper sits and I've been looking for a good way to mow, and a unit that is low maintenance and easy to store over winter. This seems to be the perfect fit. It has plenty of power, if very light weight, folds and can be stored hanging my my shed. It does take a bit to get use to the cord, but once you have a pattern down, it's not problem. Get more cord than you think you will need and make sure it's heavy gauge enough. Can't comment on durability yet, but will update after an over-winter & spring mow.
customer_reviews.author: jamestday

customer_reviews.title: Green
customer_reviews.text: I bought a used gas mower that stopped working so I finally decided to buy an electric one. It is lightweight, very easy to assemble (I did it solo), and it does a great job. I had procrastinated on buying a new one so my grass got a bit crazy, and this mower doesn't struggle. I have a small yard, during upkeep mowing it takes maybe 20 minutes? So this mower works perfectly. I hope it lasts a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: It worked great so far
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble without instructions. Very light weight. I haven't used the item yet, we were in black out. It was easy to assemble and very light weight. Only problem... I didn't like is that I pay extra for prime and item was late. It was supposed to come before power went out. But I had 2 keep checking 2 see if item was delivered then come back to house so it wouldn't be seating on porch to long. That was freaking irritating because I had some1 waiting at house the days it was supposed 2 come.
customer_reviews.author: Yolanda K. Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Basic lawn mower
customer_reviews.text: It is generally a good mower. Not sure if this is little too small for may backyard though. The wheels are small and not very easy to rotate. Might have to get a bigger one. But a decent buy overall. Easy to adjust height. Update: The wheels were too small and it was difficult to work with. Returned and got 20 inch one from Greenworks which has much bigger wheels and it was at a discounted rate of ~$160.
customer_reviews.author: Chris McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I've had this corded mower for about a month and a half I use it 1-2 times every week. This is the first mower I have purchased and used regularly, but it's been very easy to use. It runs smoothly and is able to cut through even thick and tall patches of weeds in my yard. I only use this with the mulch plug in place, but I occasionally have to lift the mower up a little bit to help the grass cuttings clear out from under the mower. So far this has been a nice little mower that gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Smith

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, you get used to the cord. Cuts through everything, need to change the bag a few times between my lawn and yard together. Amazing price for corded electric, you definitely save over gas or battery.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smoked after two years
customer_reviews.text: Blade gets dull quickly. Grass gets clogged. Height settings are not great. Motor burned up after two years due to debris entering motor because of construction.
customer_reviews.author: archiman

customer_reviews.title: Works Well, but Small
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little mower. It works well, but it's so small! My yard is average -- 110-ft x 55-ft. with a house in the middle. There is still enough yard for it to be too much for this mower. The mower works well, so if you have a small yard and live like in a condo or fourplex, it would be perfect. The mower does not turn well, however. It needs to be almost lifted to turn it. I am now scrambling to find another mower so that I don't have to die trying to cut the grass... My yard could actually handle a small riding mower, if that helps to put things into perspective.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: 2 Full Seasons of Mowing - And It Works Like a Charm!
customer_reviews.text: After messing around trying to keep TWO gas mowers operational for a couple of years, I got frustrated enough that I ordered this electric mower, just to see if it would be any better. That was the best "leap of faith" I have yet taken with machinery! This mower is sturdy, reliable, easy-to-use, and ... it's QUIET! It mows through deep grass -- I know, because I had to go a few weeks without mowing, due to shoulder surgery. It handled the deep (6+ inches) without a hitch. I highly recommend this lawn mower!
customer_reviews.author: M. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Light, maneuverable, and hangs up nicely on the wall.
customer_reviews.text: This mower is good for smaller lawns (think: 50-75ft power cord reach) and can store on the wall with handle folded. Just install two ladder screw hooks into the wall, fold the handle down and hang the unit by the rear wheel brackets. I like not having to worry about a mower with a clogged carburetor from gas going bad, and being able to make space by hanging it is another plus.
customer_reviews.author: R. Zamudio

customer_reviews.title: Great Mower for Small Yards
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't want to cut a quarter acre with this mower, but it's great for smaller spaces. It also leaves the grass looking far better groomed than what I was paying someone else to do. Half the price of a cheap gas mower, with 10% of the maintenance and far, far less noise. I chose the 16" 10 amp mower to ensure better power/area ratio. If you're cutting a healthy lawn, that should be your main consideration. It's also light and folds down easily for storage or transport.
customer_reviews.author: Kit

customer_reviews.title: Just right for me.
customer_reviews.text: Just right for our small yard. About the size of a two average size in ground pools. I live in the Houston area and store the mower in the garage. During the summer the heat in garage KILLS batteries. That's main reason why I purchased a corded mower instead of a cordless mower. The weight has pros and one con. Pros; easy to store, easy to move around and easy to lift over things. Cons; doesn't weigh enough to sink into the grass. Therefore, it rides on top of the grass. So you might have mow over areas were the grass is long a couple of times.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: So far I do like it a lot. On the smaller end so it takes me up to 2 hours to do my front and back yard which are like average size. The Cord takes getting used to but then really isn’t that bad at all. I do however realize that if I didn’t have to deal with a cord I would then immediately be much happier and therefore I regret not spending the $150 or so more for the cordless. But for what I knew I was buying it is a great machine so far.
customer_reviews.author: evan c sprauer

customer_reviews.title: If you have a large yard, beware
customer_reviews.text: We really can't complain much about this mower. We haven't had to cut grass in a number of years due to condo living, so it was a bit of shock to see how small a swath of grass a 16" radius mower cuts. However, it came quickly, set up fast, and is fairly quiet and really does a great job! No gas cans or oil mixes to worry about. Overall, we are happy with it, but if we had it to choose over again, we would pick one with a larger cutting capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Good Little Mower
customer_reviews.text: Previously I had a Earthwise electric mower. It served me well but the motor finally went..I bought this greenworks because it got good reviews..While it is a little smaller than my previous mower there are things I like better about this one..The housing and many parts are made of durable plastic which is great here in Hawaii. My other mower rusted out and had to deal with that.. This one is easy to push because it's lighter..The catch bag is very easy to put on and take off. I have a large area to mow and it seems to be able to handle it..I would recommend this mower to others.
customer_reviews.author: Over the Hill

customer_reviews.title: Nice mower for the price.  Good value.
customer_reviews.text: This mower is cheap and cheerful. Does everything the manufacturer said. Cuts the lawn well. Has reasonable safety features. It was shipped in sturdy packaging. Takes minutes to set up. You need your own power cord. The mower cord is only 12 inches long and there is a cord lock on the mower that you attach your extension to so it does not unplug from the mower cord. I use it on a lawn that is about 200 square feet. If you had a bigger lawn, you might want the next size up.
customer_reviews.author: John D.

customer_reviews.title: Just wow.
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is WOW. This thing is INCREDIBLE. If it helps anyone I’m a 5’2 girl who weighs about 120 and this mower was super easy for me to assemble and use. It got the job done quickly and quietly. My yard looked better than the other 3 people who had previously done my yard had it looking. The only thing I can complain about.... is I should have invested in the cordless one. INVEST IN THE CORDLESS!!!! 😂 I will be purchasing another one and I think I can get my yard done in half the time!
customer_reviews.author: Sydnie Shelton

customer_reviews.title: SO easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I love this mower. I am a 61 year old female and wanted a mower that I can use comfortably. I can lift the mower when needed and it is easy to push. I don't mind using the cord since I know I won't be running out of power like a battery can do. It cuts great and is easy to adjust the height. I like my grass VERY short and it cuts so well. I have not used the bag since the mulcher does such a good job. I would highly recommend this mower.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn

customer_reviews.title: Robustness and mulching
customer_reviews.text: This machine proved to be tough. I have about 1500 SF to mow every 3 to 4 weeks (borderline of politeness to my neighbors). So I have a lot of tough grass to handle with some bushes on the lot lines. It took me 2 hours to finish the task. I use it in this manner for about 2 years. For several weeks it was exposed to rain after I have given it to my tenant. It works. My previous mower was a different brand, and it has died after about a year of such treatment.
customer_reviews.author: Sergey Drabkin

customer_reviews.title: Still works like new after all these years
customer_reviews.text: I was shocked when I realized that I ordered this lawnmower during the summer of 2015 for $140 and have not had a single issue with it. Still cuts my grass like it’s brand new. Not once have I gotten it sharpened or had any work done on it. Just had to let people know how happy I am with this product now that I’m on my 5th summer with it.
customer_reviews.author: Lorie McHale

customer_reviews.title: Works well but cord is annoying
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never had an electric mower and next time I will get a battery one, but other than just not knowing how to navigate the cord — which is user error more than it is design flaw — this thing is great. Quiet for a mower, easy for tiny little me to carry up from the basement, and does its job.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Works well and survived a huge rock.
customer_reviews.text: The handle collapses with just four quick-release clamps. I actually store it in the box it was shipped in, which keeps grass from getting all over the place. I used it in mulching mode because I hate dealing with collection bags. Having the mulching option is a definite plus. Soon into the first use I ran over a huge rock and it surprisingly didn’t kill the mower! The motor does slow down a bit in thicker grass/weeds, but it was still able to handle the task. My lawn looks much better than when I was cutting it with a weed whacker :)
customer_reviews.author: Christopher T. Slaterbeck

customer_reviews.title: light weight quiet, powerful
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time, easy to put together. Live in So, Florida, contend with savage St. Augustine grass. this electric mower shredded it, no slowing, no stalling like a gas mower. lightweight, can literally push with one hand. mulches nicely, bag wasn't needed. perfect for small to medium yard. get 21" for bigger yard. definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: bill b.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality with a few bugs.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing price point and value. Works as needed. Impressed with built. Not very happy with the screws used i. Built as they have started to corrode only being used once. Will change them myself to avoid future issues... Not balanced after the bag gets full, mower will tilt back and drag but I see it as and exercise...
customer_reviews.author: MeMineMyself

customer_reviews.title: Very happy. Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: This is a beast. We bought it a couple of months ago and we cannot be more happier. Since it’s electric it is cleaner than it’s contemporaries. It’s efficient, light weight and tough. We had to clean up piles and piles of leaves over the fall and it has been super helpful. It is chorded so we knew what we were signing up for. We got a 100 ft extension chord to help us with that. I and my husband both take turns on mowing the lawn and we do it without any help. So, if you are looking for a mower which over performs in every aspect, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Madhu

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of power for such a small machine!
customer_reviews.text: I got one of these last year. I have a small yard at the house I just bought and didn't really like the idea of storing gasoline in my garage. Took a chance on this mower (I actually got a discounted previously used unit for an even lower price, the only defect was a slight ding on the top which I don't care about). I couldn't be happier, it works great and packs quite a punch. I've been surprised with how easily it chomps through even thick/overgrown grass. Maybe if you're used to some huge rider-mower with 1000 HP or whatever you'll feel this is underwhelming, but for the average guy like me it's great! Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: David H.

customer_reviews.title: Works As Promised
customer_reviews.text: This is easy to maneuver. It is lightweight and even has a built-in handle on top of the machine, so I can easily lift it up to put it in my storage shed. It cuts grass - go figure! It's got different clipper settings, so I can choose how long or short I want my grass. I enjoy not worrying about putting gas in it or the mechanical issues that tend to just go with gas mowers; and I won't have to worry about replacing a battery (as in rechargeable electric mowers). Just be careful and watch out for the cord. Works great for my purposes.
customer_reviews.author: jjb

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT  PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 70 year old woman who enjoys yardwork here in Florida. I have a fairly small yard with gardens to mow in & around. I decided on this 16" mower. It's my 2nd electric mower and after using it for the 1st time, I'm thrilled! It is so much lighter than my 1st 18" electric. I found I can push & steer it with one hand. It looks well made and the price was reasonable. I hope this lasts a long, long time, I LOVE it!
customer_reviews.author: SmilingDog

customer_reviews.title: Electric, no more hand pulling cord, had or carburetor to worry about!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE my 16", 10 amp mower!! Lightweight, nice bag grass catcher (great for my leaves and pine needles and easy to do use.) SO happy to have ordered it. Easy to adjust mow height. The only thing a bit cheesy is the plastic knobs - if I wanted to fold down the handle for easier storage, I don't know long they'd last without stripping. Strong running mower. I bought a 50 ft, 14 guage cord for my very small yard. LOVE, love love love it!!
customer_reviews.author: gOOse

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution to a small cutting area, or hill.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful, reliable product. Hits high marks for lightweight handling, reliability, sharp blades, super easy to start. My only regret was that I didn't spend the extra money to get a battery-powered model. This will work fine but the cord is cumbersome if cutting a distance from the plug. If someone manages the cord, while you cut, it goes super fast and is over. Big cutting areas ... not so much. Get the battery powered if you have the $$$.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Cardwell

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean out
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly for a the small (~50' deep backyard with a postage stamp front yard) area. Small enough to fit perfectly between some gardening raised beds, and powerful enough to have tackled some long grasses without question. This took knee-high grass down to the highest mow setting quickly. The underside gets clogged quickly if there's any moisture in the grass, especially when mulching. Easy to clean out, so not too bad. This doesn't have a water hose quick clean option, which may make this task faster. But, works well without.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce S.

customer_reviews.title: Greenworks
customer_reviews.text: I used the mower twice in six months to cut a 20’X30’ dog pen of Pensacola Bahia grass. During my third use the machine quit and hasn’t worked since
customer_reviews.author: Ernest S

customer_reviews.title: Very quick to set up, 15 minutes and mow immediately after setting up, couldn't have been easier.
customer_reviews.text: My lawn was very overgrown and I was afraid the mower would not be adequate, being somewhat small, but it performed excellently. My yard is large and uneven, but the mower held up very well and smooth. It was also rather quiet where I was expecting a loud roaring. I've no regrets.
customer_reviews.author: D BIng

customer_reviews.title: Underpowered compared to my previous electric mower that was just 6 amps!
customer_reviews.text: My previous electric mower was more powerful and could handle higher grass with no problem. Just sold the Greenworks after about 1 year and a half with it. Where I live during the summer it rains a lot, and this little machine could not keep up with the 3 to 4 inch grass that grows every week. If you don't have that much rain or don't water your lawn then this would be ok for 2 to 3 inch grass.
customer_reviews.author: Doc who

customer_reviews.title: Potential Issue
customer_reviews.text: After getting the lawnmower out of the box and assembling it I plugged it in and it wouldn't start, after about an hour on the phone with the support one we weren't able to solve the problem. I was about ready to return the lawn mower but I decided to try one last thing, I took apart the housing for the safety button and it there was a loose wire so I fixed that. After re assembly the lawn mower still wouldn't turn on turns out the handle to pull was installed upside down from the factory, after fixing that the lawn mower started.Other than that the lawn mower works great!!!
customer_reviews.author: Romeo T.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We have a narrow strip of grass in our back yard and this was the perfect solution. My husband enjoys using it and I like the quiet sound it makes. The grass catcher lets me use the clippings for compost when I need them. This is was a good addition to our garden tools. Husband wishes he had gotten the battery operated version.
customer_reviews.author: R. Best

customer_reviews.title: Lovin’ mowing again!
customer_reviews.text: This mower is great. Feels so much lighter than my old gas mower. The 16” platform is great for small lawns. No more scalping by my tree roots, as the narrower platform doesn’t allow the blade to drop down as low on uneven ground. I bought a 12ga. 100’ cord. Instructions say a 14ga. is sufficient for 100’. Remember that the cord will weigh as much as the mower at 12ga. I can push the mower with one hand and control the cord with the other. Mulching or bagging are a snap to switch to. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Manny P

customer_reviews.title: Great Mower!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this electric lawn mower in 2015. I have used it without fail ever since. The only issue I ever had was cutting my extension cord one time when I accidentally mowed over it (it only took one time to learn that lesson!). This mower starts every single time you turn it on and the blades are still as good as new. I'm in Florida, so we mow almost all year. I have been so impressed with this product that I came back to review it over 4 years later. I hope you'll love it as much as I do!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little machine!
customer_reviews.text: It’s been a while since I’ve owned any yard equipment, but I decided to let the landscapers go and quit being lazy. Practically no assembly. Attach the handles and go. This thing is really lightweight and enjoyable to work with. Definitely a smaller lawn mower, had several trips to dump the collector, but I don’t have a huge yard and could use the exercise. Definitely recommend this machine.
customer_reviews.author: James Biddle

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight easy efficient lawn mower
customer_reviews.text: Fast, easy , efficient. This lawn mower was delivered to me at 10:12 in the morning and by 10:40 I had already assembled this lawn mower, mowed my front yard , put the lawn mower away and now I'm in the house reviewing this lawn mower. This is by far the easiest lawn mower I have ever used. I absolutely love it and it is beyond my expectations. It is lightweight, I am a 70 year old woman and I had absolutely no problems putting the handle on, starting the lawn mower or using it. if I could write this lawn mower more than five stars I would.
customer_reviews.author: jet

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I received my lawn mower today. I mowed my front and back lawn with ease. It was super easy to assemble. Easy to start, easy to push. Love the settings. Bag easy to attach and remove. I let my gardener go because he kept cutting my St. Augustine grass to low and killing it, even after we spoke about it several times. So instead of being a frustrated single woman. I decided to take matters into my own hands. Reviewed several lawn mowers and found this Green works 10amp electric mower to be what I needed. I am very happy with my choice. Looks like I will be paying myself $90 a month.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Nicci

customer_reviews.title: cam lock is garbage.
customer_reviews.text: More plastic crap being pedaled on Amazon. You push this in to lock in the position of the handle bar. Originally it was SIDEWAYS and I had to crank it to put it in the position it should be. I got it in the correct position and it still won't lock. If I go further than what I did in the picture it starts to bend the plastic handle. Junk and disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: phillli

customer_reviews.title: Light and manoeuverable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mower as I have difficulty starting gas mowers. I needed a mower that is light enough to put in the back of my vehicle to take to my son's house and bring back again. The handle folds down easily making it a dream to put in the back of the vehicle and to store in my low and small storage shed. As it is corded it is such lighter than a battery operated mower would be. I have found the mower very manoeuverable around plants and paving stones when mowing the grass
customer_reviews.author: Reader Ruth

customer_reviews.title: Great electric lawnmower.  Very very happy.
customer_reviews.text: This an awesome and lightweight electric lawnmower. Easy to adjust the height and plenty of power to cut through the toughest of grass. I have some zoysia. It’s quiet and easy to push with only one hand. I can do my whole front yard with a 100 foot extension cord and then just move it all to the back.
customer_reviews.author: DavidJ

customer_reviews.title: Looks easy !
customer_reviews.text: My husband did all the work but it look pretty easy watching him from afar. It does the job pretty well. I have a large yard and lots of grass. It collects the grass in the bag at the back. It didn’t over heat either . 5 stars for me
customer_reviews.author: Tally

customer_reviews.title: Great, quality mower, wish it was cordless.
customer_reviews.text: My fiancee is all about going green so he really wanted an electric mower. This one looks really cool and definitely has the power to do the job right. The only problem is the cord, which is a pain in the butt to work around, and it always scares me that he's going to accidentally hit it and electrocute himself. For now, it's a great mower (it even inspired our neighbor to go out and get an electric mower), but we will definitely be upgrading to the cordless version in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Evin

customer_reviews.title: Bad!!!
customer_reviews.text: Already does not work....its march 30,2020 BAD....IM SINGLE AND 60 YRS OLD SO I BOUGHT BECAUSE I WANTED A LAWNMOWER EASY TO USE!!!...JUNK!! JUNK !!
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia's

customer_reviews.title: Broke after one season
customer_reviews.text: Used for one season and stored in my shed. Went to use the following season and won't work.
customer_reviews.author: Cale G.

customer_reviews.title: Still working great after 3.5 years.
customer_reviews.text: Still working great after 3.5 years. This is the best mower we've ever had, and we have a history of spending a LOT more money on gas mowers that don't last. We have a small yard and it works great. The key is to not let the grass get two feet high since this is a small mower. We also bought a big enough extension cord that I saw recommend in other reviews  US Wire 74100 12/3 100-Feet SJTW Yellow Heavy-Duty Lighted Extension Cord I was nervous that we were buying a fad item or a toy mower, but it's been 3 1/2 years and the mower is still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: cat lady

customer_reviews.title: Good mower at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Mower has worked without any issues for 6+ months. Height adjustment is super easy to use and bag is easy to attach and empty. Only downside to this is narrow width and front and back wheels don't overlap, causing some grass patches to get pushed down and not get cut. As many others have said it takes a few times to be able to learn the cord dance but not too bad. Check where your outlets are and make sure you get a cord that reaches everywhere. I am using a 25' and 50' plugged together which can come unplugged if it gets pulled to hard.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing mower
customer_reviews.text: This mower is a dream come true once I figured out how to start it (hold the button down while you pull back the lever on the handle ) I had my lawn mowed in 10 minutes. I have fought with gas mowers for 49 years I will never go back I highly recommend this to anyone didn’t loose power even in 6 inch grass
customer_reviews.author: A. Canepa

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Lawn Mower!!
customer_reviews.text: This little green machine is awesome!! I only have my front yard to mow so this is perfect for me!! It takes some getting used to with the cord but it is working well for me!!
customer_reviews.author: Josephine F. Maisano

customer_reviews.title: I like it because it does the job and folds down ...
customer_reviews.text: I put it together myself, test ran it in the yard, cleaned it off and folded it away. I like it because it does the job and folds down to a compact size so I can store it away in house instead of leaving it outside. It's light enough that I can carry it myself and with the attached carrying handle it is easy for me to carry outside and get the job done. I would recommend. There is a control for grass height I see #2 is too low for my liking so I will try #3 or #4. You and also set the handle for a height that is comfortable for you personally.
customer_reviews.author: Momz

customer_reviews.title: Great little electric corded pushmower.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed and has met my expectations and more. As a 76 year old (young) lady, and petite in size. it maneuvers quite easily, cuts the grass as needed. Oh if I had gotten it before now. Yet, better now than never. It's quite a handy product for small areas.
customer_reviews.author: Denna

customer_reviews.title: NICE SIZE AND LIGHTWEIGHT WHICH MAKES IT EASY TO PUSH ...
customer_reviews.text: NICE SIZE AND LIGHTWEIGHT WHICH MAKES IT EASY TO PUSH BACK AND FORTH...GET'S THE JOB DONE. ALSO, EASY TO STORE INSIDE OR OUTSIDE... I LIKE THE FACT I DON'T HAVE TO PURCHASE OR STORE GASOLINE AROUND THE HOUSE...THE POWER OF THIS LITTLE GUY IS ENOUGH FOR MY YARD. I HAVE A SMALL YARD (BACK & FRONT). MY NEIGHBOR LIKES IT TOO (HIS YARD IS LARGER THAN MINE. I NO LONGER HAVE TO PAY SOMEONE TO CUT MY GRASS, I CAN PAY MYSELF EVERY TIME I CUT THE GRASS AND SAVE ...IT WOULD HAVE BEEN NICE IF A COVER CAME WITH IT. SO FAR SO GOOD. I'M HAPPY AND WOULD PURCHASE AGAIN....
customer_reviews.author: Peak

customer_reviews.title: Great mower
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace an ancient Black & Decker that bit the dust. Very easy to put together, lightweight and easy to use. Never had a bag before and it fills quick and was a little difficult to empty, but I don’t use it much and have a small lawn, so just have to empty between the front and the back. Fingers crossed it lasts!
customer_reviews.author: JT Ferris

customer_reviews.title: Has that 'made in China" feel
customer_reviews.text: A very manueverable machine which seems to cut well. The clamp intended to hold the power cord against the handle is too small for outdoor power cords and the handle itself is somewhat flimsy. Also, the plastic plug which is designed to turn it into a mulching machine does not fit tightly into the rear of the mower. All in all, the design is good, but the build quality is suspect. I doubt if it will hold up as long as my previous mower (14 years) which was a Back and Decker electric. It was available at a cheap price and it proves that you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: T1705

customer_reviews.title: Finicky but good
customer_reviews.text: Lever to power on mower was finicky. After some wiggling and playing around with the safety bar, finally got it to turn on. The bar needed to be pushed forward, then on button pressed, then bar pulled back. Besides that, works well and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Awatson

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!  Runs like a Vacuum Cleaner.
customer_reviews.text: The Product works so well. My boyfriend said it gets to the Edge and I don't need a trimmer. It's like a vacuum. I am able to push this light weight lawnmower with ease. I was very skeptical of using an electric lawn mower; however, It's the best invested item I have purchased since moving into my new home. It cut the yard so well in a small amount of time frame.
customer_reviews.author: LaKeisha

customer_reviews.title: Great buy! Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I have to say for a woman who’s never touched a lawn Mower this was easy to maneuver & operate! I’m happy for my first time using it, the bag was way to remove and replace. The only thing I found hard was moving the lever up and down. Definitely would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Marissa Zee

customer_reviews.title: Good for the Money!
customer_reviews.text: I'm just about finished with the grass growing season and this mower has done the job. Do I wish it were wider, oh yes! It takes awhile to cut a lawn when the cutting swath is just 16 inches. Good mower for the money and just think about all of the excerise you are gonna' get going back and fourth...back and fourth.
customer_reviews.author: Slick

customer_reviews.title: Dead in less than one year
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last year, in the peak of summer. I probably used it a total of three times. I took it out of my garage this year and hooked it up--it is deader than a dead dodo. A total waste of money and resources. Stay away!
customer_reviews.author: S. Rajagopalan

customer_reviews.title: Switch malfunction on second use
customer_reviews.text: The second time I used this, the power switch stopped working. I sent a support request to the manufacturer via their website on July 24. As of Aug 3 (9 days) all I've received is an automated notice that they received my support request.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I like this electric lawn mower, because I have a hard time with pulling cord to start gas lawnmowers. This lawn mower is easily to operate, you just have to make sure you keep the cord to the side where you’ve already mowed . I used this type of lawn mower growing up.
customer_reviews.author: Dee Allen

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: When used on taller and/or thicker grass at lowest wheel setting you may have to mow it and then return over it with wheels up a notch to pick up the lawn clippings. Overall, very happy with the low noise and clean smell vs gas powered and happy not to deal with rechargeable battery on others.... The cord is the only problem and it is easy after your first time using it (put it between your legs when mowing).
customer_reviews.author: Sara Vu

customer_reviews.title: Not powerful at all
customer_reviews.text: Look so nice not that heavy but not that powerful , if u plan to cut ur lawn every week so this the tight one for u but if u busy and ur lawn is tall then this not good one for u , the Machine not the powerful or strong for tall lawn it will stop working
customer_reviews.author: Zika

customer_reviews.title: too difficult with the quality of extension cord needed
customer_reviews.text: returned this item. trying to mow with the cord was just too much. because it is small would take twice the time to mow as a gas run mower.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Good little mower
customer_reviews.text: I really like this mower. I have about 1000 sqft of lawn to mow and this is perfect. I like the different height adjustments and especially like the mulching feature. If the grass is tall you have to cut it at the higher level first before you cut low or else the mower loses power a bit. And you don’t want to cut wet grass, but I think that’s normal for all mowers. Easy to push, easy to fold down the handle and store away.
customer_reviews.author: Karissa C.

customer_reviews.title: Great little mower with plenty of power.
customer_reviews.text: I love this mower! It is so well designed and easy to use. It is quiet, yet powerful, and the handles fold really quickly and easily for storage. It has a sturdy handle on the base that makes it easy to carry. I have been using gas mowers for 40 years and worried if an electric mower would have enough power for tall grass, but this one has plenty of power. Changing the height is done with just one level and is trivially easy to do. Aesthetically, if that matters to anyone, is is sleek and nice looking.
customer_reviews.author: DYI devotee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a small lawn
customer_reviews.text: As an older person, easy to maneuver and light weight we’re my primary concern. This lawnmower is perfect in these respects. My only issue is that there is too much of a gap between the second to third levels. It either leaves the lawn a bit too long at the third level and too short at the second.
customer_reviews.author: M. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Greenworks 16-Inch 10 Amp Corded Mower
customer_reviews.text: Very light and easy to use, plug it in go! Works great one my small yard and folds up so that it is very easily stored. Using an extension chord takes a little practice but once you get the hang of it it is very easy. I am an older woman with neck, shoulders and back injury and I can use this mower with ease. I bought the smallest one as I didn't realize how light and easy it would be to use and the only thing I would change would be to get the larger one now that I know this.
customer_reviews.author: goatbone1260

customer_reviews.title: We like it!
customer_reviews.text: I was able to assemble the unit in about 10 min and cut the grass right away. This mower is light and easy to move and because it's not so wide I can fit it into tight areas around a bench that's on my lawn and under the bushes that hang over the lawn in places. I'm really happy with this mower so far. This is the second one of this brand that we have. The old one still works but it was cheaper to get a new one than have the blades sharpened. About the only thing I would like is to see replacement blades made available.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Younger

customer_reviews.title: and I'm so happy I made the change
customer_reviews.text: I switched to this mower after getting fed up with a reel mower, and I'm so happy I made the change. The cord isn't really a big deal, and it has plenty of power to cut my gras. The height adjustment is super easy. The removable bag is very convenient, and it's quick to switch between catching the clippings and mulching. I guess the only slight frustration is that if I've waited longer than I'm supposed to between mowings, the bag fills up pretty quickly. But those clippings make a fantastic addition to my compost bin.
customer_reviews.author: Animator geek

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: I have a very small lawn which is why I purchased this. Excellent value... heck it's about the price of a good weed eater (and I had considered using a weed eater given the size of my lawn)! The only downside is making sure your power cord is out of the way when mowing... which is a constant throughout the mowing process. But, I don't have to buy gas... or mix gas with oil. It reliably starts with a push of a button! I recommend this mower!
customer_reviews.author: David Cozadd

product_meta.title: Greenworks 16-Inch 10 Amp Corded Electric Lawn Mower 25142
product_meta.description: Size:16 inch| Style:Electric 10 Amp| Pattern Name:MowerGreenworks, 10 Amp 16-Inch 2 in 1, Rear Bag or Mulch Electric Lawn Mower, Converts Easily from Rear Bag to Mulch, Model # 25142
feature_bullets: Your purchase includes One Greenworks 16" 10 Amp Corded Electric Lawn Mower, 25142 model
Lawn Mower dimensions – 52.05” L x 19.21” W x 41” H | Wheels size – 7” and 8” | Cutting width – 17”
2-in-1 feature offers rear bagging and mulching capability for multiple use
The unit is made of high quality durable plastic, which allows it to be light in weight and easy to maneuver
Single lever 5-position height adjustment offers cutting height range from 1-1/4 inch to 3-3/8-inch for the best cut in all environments

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,562 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
